org.microbean.jersey.netty

Class JerseyChannelInboundHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerAdapter
      • io.netty.channel.ChannelInboundHandlerAdapter
        • io.netty.channel.SimpleChannelInboundHandler<HttpObject>
          • org.microbean.jersey.netty.JerseyChannelInboundHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelHandler, ChannelInboundHandler

    public class JerseyChannelInboundHandler
extends SimpleChannelInboundHandler<HttpObject>
    A SimpleChannelInboundHandler that adapts Jersey to Netty.

    Thread Safety

    Instances of this class are safe for concurrent use by multiple threads, but certain methods must be invoked in the Netty event loop.

    Author:
    Laird Nelson

    • Constructor Detail

      • JerseyChannelInboundHandler

        public JerseyChannelInboundHandler(URI baseUri,
                                   ApplicationHandler applicationHandler,
                                   BiFunction<? super ChannelHandlerContext,? super HttpRequest,? extends SecurityContext> securityContextBiFunction)
        Creates a new JerseyChannelInboundHandler.
        Parameters:
        baseUri - the base URI for the Jersey application; may be null in which case the return value resulting from invoking URI.create("/") will be used instead
        applicationHandler - the Jersey ApplicationHandler that will actually run the Jersey application; may be null in which case a new ApplicationHandler will be used instead
        securityContextBiFunction - a BiFunction that returns a SecurityContext when supplied with a ChannelHandlerContext and an HttpRequest; may be null

    • Method Detail

      • channelRead0

        protected final void channelRead0(ChannelHandlerContext channelHandlerContext,
                                  HttpObject message)
                           throws Exception
        Arranges for the ApplicationHandler supplied at construction time to process the HTTP message represented by the supplied HttpObject.

        This method must be invoked in the Netty event loop.

        Specified by:
        channelRead0 in class SimpleChannelInboundHandler<HttpObject>
        Parameters:
        channelHandlerContext - the ChannelHandlerContext representing the current Netty execution; must not be null
        message - the HttpObject—an HttpRequest or a HttpContent—to process; must not be null
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs
        See Also:
        messageReceived(ChannelHandlerContext, HttpRequest), messageReceived(ChannelHandlerContext, HttpContent)

      • messageReceived

        protected void messageReceived(ChannelHandlerContext channelHandlerContext,
                               HttpRequest httpRequest)
                        throws Exception
        Processes the supplied HttpRequest representing one portion of an overall HTTP message.

        Internally, a ContainerRequest is created, a new NettyContainerResponseWriter is installed on it, and the ApplicationHandler.handle(ContainerRequest) method is invoked on a thread guaranteed not to be the Netty event loop.

        This method must be invoked in the Netty event loop.

        Parameters:
        channelHandlerContext - the ChannelHandlerContext representing the current Netty execution; must not be null
        httpRequest - the HttpRequest to process; must not be null
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs
        See Also:
        createContainerRequest(ChannelHandlerContext, HttpRequest), ApplicationHandler.handle(ContainerRequest), ExecutorServiceProvider, NettyContainerResponseWriter

      • createNettyContainerResponseWriter

        protected NettyContainerResponseWriter createNettyContainerResponseWriter(HttpRequest httpRequest,
                                                                          ChannelHandlerContext channelHandlerContext,
                                                                          Supplier<? extends ScheduledExecutorService> scheduledExecutorServiceSupplier)
        Creates and returns a new NettyContainerResponseWriter when invoked.

        This method never returns null.

        Overrides of this method must not return null.

        This implementation simply invokes the NettyContainerResponseWriter.NettyContainerResponseWriter(HttpRequest, ChannelHandlerContext, Supplier) constructor and returns the new object.

        In normal usage, this method is invoked in the Netty event loop.

        This method is called by the messageReceived(ChannelHandlerContext, HttpRequest) method. Overrides must not call that method or an infinite loop may result.

        Parameters:
        httpRequest - the HttpRequest being processed; must not be null
        channelHandlerContext - the ChannelHandlerContext representing the current Netty execution; must not be null
        scheduledExecutorServiceSupplier - a Supplier that can supply a ScheduledExecutorService; must not be null
        Returns:
        a new NettyContainerResponseWriter; never null
        See Also:
        NettyContainerResponseWriter.NettyContainerResponseWriter(HttpRequest, ChannelHandlerContext, Supplier), messageReceived(ChannelHandlerContext, HttpRequest)

      • messageReceived

        protected void messageReceived(ChannelHandlerContext channelHandlerContext,
                               HttpContent httpContent)
                        throws Exception
        Processes the supplied HttpContent representing one portion of an overall HTTP message.

        Internally, the HttpContent's content, if readable, is retained and added to an internal ByteBufQueue implementation created by the messageReceived(ChannelHandlerContext, HttpRequest) method. Then, if the HttpContent is an instance of LastHttpContent, that internal ByteBufQueue is closed.

        This method must be invoked in the Netty event loop.

        Parameters:
        channelHandlerContext - the ChannelHandlerContext representing the current Netty execution; must not be null
        httpContent - the HttpContent to process; must not be null
        Throws:
        Exception - if an error occurs

      • createContainerRequest

        protected ContainerRequest createContainerRequest(ChannelHandlerContext channelHandlerContext,
                                                  HttpRequest httpRequest)
        Creates a ContainerRequest representing the supplied HttpRequest and returns it.

        This method never returns null.

        Internally, this method sets up an internal ByteBufQueue if necessary representing incoming entity data. The ByteBufQueue in question is an instance of EventLoopPinnedByteBufInputStream and is also installed on the ContainerRequest.

        The internals of this method also may allocate a CompositeByteBuf which will be released when the underlying Channel closes.

        This method must be invoked in the Netty event loop.

        Parameters:
        channelHandlerContext - the ChannelHandlerContext representing the current Netty execution; must not be null
        httpRequest - the HttpRequest to process; must not be null
        Returns:
        a new ContainerRequest; never null
        See Also:
        ContainerRequest, EventLoopPinnedByteBufInputStream, ByteBufQueue
